intro: Libanotis wannienchun, commonly known as the Wannienchun bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
